result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Thomas Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Thomas Morgan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Thomas Morgan was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Jason Thomas Morgan.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF404 and 22CF246. State recites agreement. In 21CF404, defendant will plead to count 1. Sentence of 1 year jail imposed and stayed for 2 year of probation (concurrent to 22CF246 if revoked). Conditions of 6 month jail with credit for 101 days concurrent to 22CF246 $100 fine plus costs. Counts 2,3, and 4 will be dismissed. In 22CF404, defendant will plead to count 1. Sentence of 1 year jail imposed and stayed for 2 year of probation (concurrent to 21CF404 if revoked). Conditions of 6 month jail with credit for 101 days concurrent to 21CF404, $2,072 plus costs, 27 month license revocation, IID, and a DSP and assessment. 21CF404 counts 2,3, and 4 will be dismissed. 
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 in 21CF404 and count 1 in 22CF246. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas. In 22CF246, counts 2,3, and 4 will be dismissed. In 21CF404, counts 2,3, and 4 will be dismissed. 
Court orders in 22CF246, on count 1. Sentence of 1 year jail imposed and stayed for 2 years of probation. Conditions of 6 month jail with credit for 101 days concurrent to 22CF246, $100 fine plus costs. Doc programming.  
Court orders in 21CF404, on count 1. Sentence of 1 year jail imposed and stayed for 2 year of probation. Conditions of 6 month jail with credit for 101 days concurrent to 21CF404, $2,072 fine, 27 month license revocation, 27 months IID, and DSP and assessment, Doc programming.
Consecutive jail sentences if revoked and consecutive to any other sentence. Concurrent probations.

10:03 AM Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Jason Thomas Morgan.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF404 and 22CF246. Attorney Gramstrup notes that there has been an issue on whether this is a 4th or 5th OWI. State notes that there have been communications with the Attorney General. Attorney Gramstrup asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Jason Thomas Morgan.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF246, Attorney Gramstrup received information waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Asks for another status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Jason Thomas Morgan.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Gramstrup makes argument for bail reduction. Could post $750. Requests court reduce bail to that amount plus a large signature bond. Indicates defendant mixed up dates, that is why he missed court in May. 
State argues has had other FTA's in other counties. Argues bail should remain as is due to his past FTA's. In the alternative $750 in each file would be more appropriate rather than $750 in both files. 
Attorney Gramstrup indicated address in superior is correct, not Two Harbors as he indicated. 
Court makes statements. Notes prior FTA's. Did not appear until taken into custody on new charges. Does not believe excuse of mixed up dates. Defendant was provided notice and was sent notice of bail bond forfeiture. 
Motion for bail reduction is denied.
Bail/bond hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
11:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Jason Thomas Morgan. 
Att Gramstrup- Client will waive prelim on 22CF246
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets next date
Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason Thomas Morgan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Jason Thomas Morgan. Defendant's address confirmed. Court calls cases 21CF404 and 22CF246. In 22CF246, Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. Court quashes warrant in 21CF404. State asks for $2000 cash in each matter. In 22CF246 No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 21CF404 No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol. Recites defendant's FTAs in those county and other WI county and criminal history. Attorney Reid notes defendant is a local resident, has family in the area, and has significant ties to the state of WI. Asks for $500 cash bond to cover both files. Defendant makes statement about missed court dates. Can post up to $100.

Court orders $1000 in 22CF246. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Orders $1000 in 21CF404. No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
